p: Serologic surveys before 2000 indicated that Pacific marine mammals had not been exposed to PDV [ 31, 32], and this virus had never been identified as the cause of illness or death in the North Pacific Ocean (NPO). PDV was first confirmed in sea otters in the NPO in 2004 [ 33], posing the question of whether reductions in sea ice believed to be due to global warming could increase contact between arctic and subarctic marine mammals and lead to viral transmission across the Arctic Ocean.
